overview: Rishikesh is a small town in Uttarakhand, northern India, situated where the Ganges descends from the Himalayas. It is famed as the World Capital of Yoga and serves as a gateway to the Uttarakhand Himalayas and the Char Dham pilgrimage circuit.
bestTimeToVisit: February–March and August–October (avoid July due to the Savan festival and road closures)
travelTips: Take a bus from Delhi (₹130–₹350) or a train to Haridwar and a short bus/taxi to Rishikesh for the cheapest access.
Use shared auto‑rickshaws (≈₹15) or rickshaws to cross the Ganges at Ram Jhula.
Stay in budget hostels in Tapovan for dirt‑cheap accommodation.
Walk around Swargashram; the area is pedestrian‑only and easy to explore on foot.
Avoid travelling in July when the Savan festival causes road blocks and crowded hotels.
Carry cash in INR for small‑scale transport and meals; ATMs are available near the bus station.
